body.p: You may want to develop your own client applications that interface with Greenplum Database. PostgreSQL provides database drivers for the most commonly used database application programming interfaces (APIs), which can also be used with Greenplum Database. Each driver is an independent PostgreSQL development project and must be installed and configured to connect to Greenplum Database. The drivers can be built from source or downloaded from their websites. Pivotal Greenplum Database customers can download an installer with supported client APIs from Pivotal Network. The following drivers are available:

row.entry: http://www.postgresql.org/ftp/odbc/. Also available in the Pivotal Greenplum Database Connectivity package.

body.p: General instructions for accessing a Greenplum Database with an API are:

ol.li: Download your programming language platform and respective API from the appropriate source. For example, you can get the Java Development Kit (JDK) and JDBC API from Oracle.

Write your client application according to the API specifications. When programming your application, be aware of the SQL support in Greenplum Database so you do not include any unsupported SQL syntax.
See the Greenplum Database Reference Guide for more information.

body.p: Download the appropriate PostgreSQL driver and configure connectivity to your Greenplum Database master instance.
